org.metastatic.sexp4j

Class AdvancedWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.metastatic.sexp4j.AdvancedWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Writer

    public class AdvancedWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Writer
    A Writer implementation for the advanced encoding.

      • writeAtom

        public int writeAtom(Atom atom)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Write an atom.

        It is invalid to write an atom if a single atom has already been written, or if a list in its entirety has been written previously.

        Specified by:
        writeAtom in interface Writer
        Parameters:
        atom - The atom to write.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written.
        Throws:
        WriteException - If an illegal write state occurs.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

      • writeList

        public int writeList(ExpressionList list)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Write a list.

        It is invalid to write a list if a single atom was written as the only value, or if a complete list was written previously.

        Specified by:
        writeList in interface Writer
        Parameters:
        list - The list to write.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written.
        Throws:
        WriteException - If an illegal write state occurs.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

      • beginList

        public void beginList()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Begin a list. You don't need to call this along with Writer.writeList(ExpressionList), this method exists to support writing expressions without building them as ExpressionList instances first.
        Specified by:
        beginList in interface Writer
        Throws:
        WriteException - If it is illegal to begin a list in the current state.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

      • endList

        public void endList()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        End a list. You should call this if you use the Writer.beginList() method to start a list.
        Specified by:
        endList in interface Writer
        Throws:
        WriteException - if it is illegal to end a list in the current state.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

      • writeExpression

                    throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Write an expression.
        Specified by:
        writeExpression in interface Writer
        Parameters:

        Returns:
